title: For Sale:  1953 FN / Browning Hi-Power Pistol (Post-WW II)
postcontent:
I am a big fan of John M. Browning's pistol designs, the 1911 and GP35 or Hi-Power. 
Offered here for sale (not trade) is a fine example of a post war Hi-Power. This is a well maintained, fully functioning, original pistol with only one part replaced. Conservatively, about 90% + condition. This comes with one original, aluminum follower 13 round magazine. This has not been refinished or monkeyed with and has an intact magazine disconnector. It's been kept in a silicone gun sock when not in use and always cleaned and oiled after use. For me, it's functioned without flaws since the internal extractor (similar to a 1911) has been carefully tuned and replaced. Original extractor is included with the sale. Pistols of this age and quality are quite scarce and sought after by those who really like this pistol. As this is a tad below true "collector quality", yet in outstanding condition for it's age, you can still shoot it! Okay, here's what you really want to know: Price is $800, FIRM. NO-TRADES. Must have OHIO driver's licence, be willing to meet in Columbus or FFL to FFL transfer with you paying the shipping. You must be eligible to purchase a firearm and be willing to sign a bill of sale for my records. As always, you should have this pistol checked for safety by a qualified gunsmith before firing, however it's been flawless for me and I can offer no warranty, nor be held responsible should something go wrong. I'm not in the firearms business, just a shooter as I imagine you are as well. Please contact me if you're serious and I can try to answer any questions or arrange to meet up. Low ball offers/trade offers will be ignored, so please don't bother. If there's no interest, I will be posting on gunbroker.com in a few days.

The gun has a thumb safety on the left side and also has a magazine disconnect safety. The gun is in good working order and has been test fired. 
Included is a box of Remington ammo.  47 rounds out of 50 are still in the box.

Approx. dimensions: 6" long x 4" high x 1" wide. 
Empty weight = 16.2 oz. 

Made in Spain between 1962 and 1964. 

Some information I was able find online: 
The Model GZ (Modle GZ), according to Josserand and Huon, was originally made in France, beginning on 1 January 1957, but the license was sold to Echasa (Echave y Arizmendi) in Eibar, Spain in 1962. I have a photograph of a French-made GZ, otherwise I might doubt it was ever made in France. The Model GZ is nearly identical to the Model G with the external hammer, but has distinctly different slide serrations. Some GZs have five broad, angled, square-cut slide serrations, while others have eight narrow angled square-cut serrations. Huon states that the GZ has an alloy frame. The Spanish GZ has an alloy frame, and was available in .22, .25, .32, and .380. The Spanish-made guns are clearly marked ECHASA. EIBAR (ESPAA) and MAB ESPAOLA on the left side of the slide, and some have MAB ESPAOLA on the grips as well. Production ended in May 1964.

Until the onslaught of pot-metal pistols like the current plague of Hi-Points began in the 1980s, cheap pistols were solidly and artistically made. These magazines fit the older Italian Made F.I.E. and Excam / Targa models E-22, E-22BW, and GT-22. They are all steel, 10 Shot capacity, caliber .22 Long Rifle, never issued or sold. We found them in an old Midwestern warehouse, where theyve been sitting since Excam went down the tubes 20 years ago and were only able to get a few of them. Manufacturer is Tangfolio of Italy, the original manufacturer of the good little pistols. Only the finger rest and followers are made of polymer. The pistols themselves work best with precision made .22 cartridges, like Aguila, Federal, or Winchester. In our experience, the E-22 type did not like Remington or CCI ammunition. Our # XMP380OS

NO NYC. This listing is for THREE Magazines; buyers, however, may take any number of extras at the same per-mag price and with no additional shipping charges. Here are old stock factory magazines to fit the Davis Industries model P380 pistols like the ones showing in our photos. The Davis P380s, of course, were compact ancestors to the current production Hi-Point pistols. These magazines will not, however, fit the Hi-Point, because it is too short for those. This magazine will fit Davis Industries P380, Jiminez J380, Jennings Bryco 38, and identical pistols whose magazine well is exactly 3 1/8 inches from the butt to the closed breech on its under side. Take your magazine out of your pistol, leave its slide closed, and run a ruler up into the magazine well inside the grip frame. It should measure exactly 3 1/8 inches. These magazines will not fit a Beretta .380; will not fit an FIE .380; will not fit the slots on a Square D electrical breaker box. They will only fit the Davis P380 and its identical clones manufactured by Jennings, Bryco, and Jiminez whose magazine well is 3 1/8 inches deep, and that hold a magazine of this ones dimensions: 3.35 inches measured on the perpendicular from the floor plate to the follower; 1.065 inches long on the outside; .450 inch thick; and that holds 5 rounds of .380 ACP caliber ammunition. Construction on these is steel body annealed to a pot metal floor plate, and with steel spring and an orange polymer cartridge follower as the photos show. These magazines were manufactured during the late 1990s. They have not been issued or fired or even loaded, but they have been stored together in bulk. Their bodies show some toning and tarnishing, and even some greasy residue in some cases. They are, however, all new but old stock. We were glad to find them in an old Southern Warehouse where theyve been for over a decade. We have a Davis P380 that had not magazine, and some of our photos show it. Buyers will receive one of the magazines in the photos, or one from the exact same lot as the photo specimens. These magazines have been hard for us to find. When our present supply is gone, there wont be any more. Single mag price is $35.00. Were offering them in lots of 3 or more, however, at $26 each. Own 3 for only $ 78.00. Not for sale to residents of New York City. Any magazine deliveries into New York City require written permission of the Police Commissioner, so we cannot ship magazines into New York City, per NYC Code 10-131.10.

title: For Sale:  .30 caliber barrel - Needs serious gunsmith work
postcontent: For Sale  The sad result of a bad gunsmith job.  About 15 years ago, I purchased a Douglas barrel blank, and paid a local gunsmith to build a 30-06 on my FN Mauser large-ring action.  Well, he botched the sight installation, but the rifle shot pretty well, and I couldnt do anything about it anyway, so I hunted with it for years.  Lately, I got the notion to re-bore and re-chamber to a larger caliber, so I sent it off to Oregon to a guy who specializes in that work.  When he removed the barrel, he discovered the original gunsmith had also botched the threading, leaving only 2 or 2  threads to hold it on.  He advised that it was unsafe to shoot in that condition, and sent it back.  So, short version, we have a .30 caliber, 1 in 10 twist, 24 inch barrel, heavy contour (.75 inches at muzzle) that needs re-threading, rechambering, and maybe a new muzzle crown.  Not worth it for me to pay a gunsmith, but for someone with the tools and skills, this could easily make a nice .308 barrel.  I will ship anywhere in the US, but Ill need your zip code to quote shipping and insurance.  Payment by USPS Money Order only, unless youre local, and cash is king.

postcontent:
I operate NOCO Hydrographics here in Fort Collins. If you're looking to get a firearm hydrodipped, I offer both the best prices as well as the best quality materials. I know how important quality is when it comes to any firearm work, and that's why I strive to be the best in the business. When you bring me one of your firearms, you can rest assured that the job will be done right, and come out looking great. After the pattern is applied, the part is coated with a high-strength clear coat with an internal flex agent. This means that the clear will flex without cracking when the gun is fired, and will last through many years of use.

I have over 700 patterns available in categories such as:
Camouflage
Carbon Fiber
Wood Grain
Stone
Metal
and Designer

title: For Sale:  454 Casull Ammo - 325 gr. L.B.T. - L.F.N. (1,525 fps/M.E. 1,678 ft. lbs.) - 20 Round Box
postcontent:
http://extreme-impact-ammo.com/index.php?l=product_detail&p=56

The .454 Casull is one cartridge that Buffalo Bore Ammunition does not load to it's full pressure limit. When loaded to it's full pressure potential the .454 Casull can become unreliable and unpleasant to shoot. At upper pressure levels, heavy bullets tend to jump crimp - tying up the cylinder. (wouldn't this be great in an emergency) Also, fired brass can stick in the chambers. 

Buffalo Bore Ammunition feels that a 360 gr. bullet (or 325 gr. bullet at 1525 fps) at 1425 fps is still very powerful, comfortable to shoot, and TOTALLY RELIABLE. At these levels, these bullets give up nothing in killing performance.

Trigger Pull DA 10.0 lbs or 5.5-6.5 lb (DAK)
Trigger Pull SA 4.4 lbs
Overall Length 6.7 in
Overall Height 4.5 in
Overall Width 1.3 in
Barrel Length 3.5 in
Sight Radius 5.3 in
Weight w/Mag 29.0 oz
Mag Capacity 12 Rounds (9mm), 10 Rounds (.40S&W, .357SIG)
Sights SIGLITE Night Sights
Grips Black Polymer Factory Grips
Frame Finish Black Hard Anodized
Slide Finish Nitron
Accessory Rail No
Features Sub-Compact, Double stack mag., One Piece Grip
MSRP $1,149.00
Despite its small size, the P224 maintains a double-stack magazine for a capacity of 12+1 rounds of 9mm
and 10 rounds of .40S&W or .357SIG giving the P224 a decided advantage over most subcompact
competitors. Newer model P229 magazines can also be used for an even greater round count.
Featuring a lightweight alloy frame, the P224 will be available in a number of configurations. Initial models
will be available with the Double-Action Kellerman (DAK) trigger and be chambered in .40S&W. and
.357SIG Traditional DA/SA triggers, and 9mm options will be available in the future.
Full-size SIGLITE Night Sights allow the P224 to deliver pinpoint accuracy, which can be a challenge in
most subcompacts.
New P224 Subcompact a Classic SIG SAUER, with One Small Change An ideal concealed carry or back-up gun, the P224 is an especially good choice for those familiar with the SIG SAUER manual of arms. From the full-sized P226 to the P229 to the P224, the controls and operation all remain the same.
The P224 accepts newer P229 magazines, allowing users to carry a full-size spare magazine as a backup to the flush-fit P224 magazine. Law enforcement officers will appreciate not having to carry separate magazines solely for their backup guns.

postcontent: A BEAUTIFUL CONDITION Colt 1911 that was manufactured in 1919. The "C" prefix [ C-114777 ] places this gun as a scarce commercial model (most in that time period were US Army guns). title: For Sale:  JP Clabrough 10ga SxS shotgun with Laminated barrels
postcontent: A late turn of the century beautifully proportioned 10 Bore bar action sidelock toplever Hammer Gun. Fine laminated 31 inch Damascus choked barrels. FNH 17S units with 16" chrome lined barrel (16k service life), aluminum receiver w/ 4 rails, flash hider, folding stock, collapsible, adjustable LOP, adjustable, comb, ambi controls w/ switchable charging handle, folding front rear FNH factory sights, five (5) factory 20 round matching magazines, Ranger edition laser cut case holds SCAR w/ folded stock and all accessories, rollers, matching FDE foregrip. The SCAR is delivered as a battle carbine with battle trigger which means they are horrific.. Special Forces unit armorers have replaced these units with Geissele units (select fire) from the beginning and cleaned up the interiors. That said Rangers are for the most part stuck with the factory units.. these upgraded SCAR units DO have Geissele trigger units installed; 2 stage with second release 2-2.5lbs enabling precision work. Shown with the Trijicon 6x issue ACOG. This unit is simply awesome with a BDC ballistic drop compensator out to 1200 meters.. target at 800? Put the "8" on it. 1200 meters away.. put the"12" on target. Steel cap retention devices, distance/range use, red chevron, upper picatinny rail, fiber optics (adjustable) for day with tritium for night. Battery free, waterproof 100+ meters, dustproof. title: For Sale:  Beretta BM 59 Rifles
postcontent: Basically, the BM59 can be described as re-chambered M1 Garand, with addition of the removable 20 rounds magazine and select fire trigger. Another addition was a flash-hider of NATO-standard diameter, which also served as a rifle grenade launcher. To launch grenades, one must turn on gas cut-off valve by raising grenade front sight, mounted on the gas block. If it will not be done, the excessive gas pressure will damage the rifle. BM59 is a gas operated rifle, with gas chamber and gas piston located under the barrel. Chamber locks by the rotating bolt with two massive lugs. Fire mode selector/safety switch is located at the front of the triggerguard, charging handle is attached to the gas rod and reciprocates during the fire cycyle

title: For Sale:  Lots of 3 or more Magazine Grip Adapters S&W 6906 type Converts 5900 Mag to 6900 NIB Smith & Wesson 9mm Models 469 669 6904 6906 6946 $19 per on 3 or more
location: TN 90 mi East of Memphis, Memphis, Tennessee
postcontent:
Our # XMGP2P

Shoppers please note that the magazine is not included in this listing, only the adapter. This listing is for THREE grip adapters assemblies. Buyers, however, may take any number of extras at the same per-assembly price and with no additional shipping charges. Here is a piece we installed a lot of back in the 1980s and early 1990s, Precision Gun Specialties grip adapter that makes a full size 5906 or 5900 type Smith & Wesson magazine fit the venerable 6906 or 6900 type Smith & Wesson Metal Frame Compact 9mms; they work perfectly on the older 469 and 669 Mini S&Ws as well. These will also fit the current production fifteen round Mec-Gar magazines numbers SW5915B and SW5915N. They will NOT work for Mec-Gar numbers 5910 and 5917, however. The tail pieces are different from the factory mags on the tens and seventeen rounders made by Mec-Gar, but the Mec-Gar fifteens are the same as the factory Smith & Wessons. No One regards the 6900 Smith & Wessons more highly than we do, but their compactness renders them less than ergonomic for protracted firing sessions, especially for folks like some of us with hands like Gatemouth Browns. These outfits have always been popular with law enforcement officers who carry them for backup in tactical situations, like drug agents who use the full capacity 6906 6946 type compacts and then have larger, but good feeling extra magazines. The adapters themselves are still manufactured by our old friends at Precision Gun Specialties; and they are relatively easy to install. We just remove the floorplate, install the adapter sleeve, and then slide in the PGS replacement floorplate. These adapters also work on 4000 series magazines, 4006 and 4003 mags, to fit into some variants of the 4013TSW and similar; the .40 compacts, though, have to be the ones capable of accepting double stacked magazines, not the single stacked ones like the old 4013 variants. Its literally just a snap to put one of these on the longer magazines. Single adapter price is $23.00. Were offering the adapters separately, however, in lots of 3 or more at only $16 each. Own 3 for only $ 48.00. For the Magazines themselves, please use Guns America search terms 5900 Robertson.

Grips, Magazines, slings, holsters, scopes, mounts, parts & most any small light items, entire accessory orders only $10.00 USPS Priority Mail with Adult Signature, total shipping no matter how many a person buys. A responsible adult will have to sign for the package! $10.00for an entire order, Not $10.00 per item or anything of the sort. $20 Flat Fee on magazine orders to Alaska, Hawaii, or Puerto Rico. MC/Visa/Discover/USPS MO paid orders shipped ASAP. Internet phone hours 8:30  4:30 CST Mon  Fri. Robertson Trading Post 117 Front Street PO Box 365 Henderson, Tennessee 38340. We buy, sell, and trade. Always have, since 1952.
